details.content: CLICK HERE FOR OLDER UPDATES

details.title: Major updates in last 20 hours
details.content:
• 2710 new cases, 37 deaths in Tamil Nadu; complete lockdown in Madurai from 24-30 June
  • Delhi chief secretary asks officials to implement all MHA directions to contain COVID-19
  • No reopening of schools in Madhya Pradesh in July
  • Krishna Raja Market (city market) and Kalasipalyam Market in Karnataka's Bengaluru sealed for 15 days
  • Karnataka Medical Education Minister Sudhakar's father tests positive for COVID-19
  • India has one of the lowest cases per lakh population: Health Ministry
  • Separate instructions from LG Kiran Bedi disrupting COVID-19 fight: Puducherry Health Minister
  • Karnataka CM directs officials to enforce lockdown norms in high-incidence areas
  • Sex workers in Pune seek to resume work with caution, SOPs

details.title: Delhi govt issues SOPs for management of patients who have tested positive
details.content:
Delhi Govt issues SOPs for mgmt of patients who've tested positive for #COVID19.

Patients on home isolation will be discharged from treatment as per discharge policy of Ministry of Health & Family Welfare which mandates discharge from home isolation after 10 days: Govt of Delhi pic.twitter.com/jwpiiFKMPH

— ANI (@ANI) June 22, 2020

details.title: Karnataka MLA's wife, daughter test positive
details.content:
@mla_sudhakar said his wife and daughter have tested positive for #Covid19. He and his two sons have tested negative.@XpressBengaluru @NewIndianXpress

— Ranjani (@ranjanikanth_) June 23, 2020

details.title: India reports 14,933 new cases, 312 deaths in 24 hours
details.content:
312 deaths and spike of 14933 new #COVID19 positive cases reported in India in last 24 hrs.

Positive cases in India stand at 440215 including 178014 active cases, 248190 cured/discharged/migrated & 14011 deaths: Ministry of Health pic.twitter.com/umx0uWIsKU

— ANI (@ANI) June 23, 2020

details.title: Omni bus ferrying Migrant workers with e-pass seized by police in Tamil Nadu
details.content:
Omni bus, which ferried #MigrantWorkers from #Rajasthan to #Coimbatore with fake e-pass seized by police at Karumathampatti checkpost on Tuesday morning. Health officials taken sample from 30 migrants including 3 woman & 2 children for #COVID19 testing. @NewIndianXpress @xpresstn pic.twitter.com/QseV8apMIx

— S Mannar Mannan (@mannar_mannan) June 23, 2020

1 servitor found positive for #COVID19 during tests ahead of #PuriRathYatra as per #SupremeCourt directive. Samples of 1143 servitors tested. The servitor shifted to Covid Hospital before #RathYatra rituals. His contact tracing is being done. #Odisha @NewIndianXpress

details.title: Centre should resume flights to Emirates for benefit of NRKs, demand Kerala CM
details.content:
In the wake of #Dubai allowing residents to return from June 22 & permitting tourists and other visitors from July 10, Centre should resume flights to the emirate for the benefit of NRKs, demands CM @vijayanpinarayi in an email to PM @narendramodi.@xpresskerala @NewIndianXpress

— Sovi Vidyadharan (@sovividyadharan) June 23, 2020

details.title: 71.3 lakh samples tested till June 22
details.content:
The total no.of samples tested up to 22 June is 71,37,716. including 1,87,223 samples tested yesterday: Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) pic.twitter.com/MIwKy8Ks1C

— ANI (@ANI) June 23, 2020

details.title: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy seeks 20-day complete lockdown in Bengaluru
details.content: In a series of tweets, HD Kumaraswamy insisted that Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa should order a complete lockdown, at least in Bengaluru for the next 20 days to save lives of citizens and warned that the state will head the Brazil way if lockdown is not implemented. The Karnataka government on Monday had decided to seal off adjoining roads from where cases emanate in wards that have reported more than 3-4 cases. Kumaraswamy called this strategy futile. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

⚡️ Out of the 1,143 servitors #Puri #JagannathTemple, only one found positive for #COVID19. Those tested negative only allowed to participate in the festival.@XpressOdisha @Siba_TNIE #RathYatra #PuriRathYatra
Here's all you need to know 👇https://t.co/LzdmU6d593

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) June 23, 2020

details.title: Delhi dy CM writes to L-G to withdraw order that positive patients must visit quarantine centre for clinical assessment
details.content:
After Lt Governor ordered that every #COVID positive patient is required to visit quarantine centre for clinical assessment, a lot of pressure is being built on people. So, I have written a letter to LG requesting him to withdraw this order: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia pic.twitter.com/j4FW3wjinz

— ANI (@ANI) June 23, 2020

details.title: Karnataka announces COVID-19 treatment cap for private hospitals
details.content: The package rates for COVID-19 patients referred by the public health authorities shall be as Rs 5,200 for general ward, Rs 7000 for High Dependency Unit, Rs 8,500 for isolation ICU without ventilator and Rs 10,000 for isolation ICU with ventilator. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Corona positive RJD vice president resigns from party
details.content: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) national vice president Raghuvansh Prasad Singh, who is under treatment for COVID-19 at AIIMS Patna, resigned from his post on Tuesday.

details.title: No new COVID-19 reported in Sri Lanka since last three days
details.content: Sri Lanka has not reported any new COVID-19 case in the last three days since June 20, which were all imported, it was reported on Tuesday. The total count of confirmed COVID-19 cases currently stands at 1,951, with 11 deaths, reports the Daily Financial Times newspaper.

details.title: Haryana to fix cost of Covid-19 treatment in private hospitals, says health minister
details.content: The Haryana government will soon issue an order fixing the cost of COVID-19 treatment in private hospitals, Health Minister Anil Vij said on Tuesday. Vij said that he had discussed the modalities with senior officials of his department and a formal order would be issued soon.

details.title: Eight more COVID-19 deaths in AP as cases shoot up to 9,834
details.content: The COVID-19 tally in Andhra Pradesh increased to 9,834 at 10 a.m. on Tuesday, with another 462 new cases reported in the last 24 hours from the 20,639 samples tested. Eight more casualties were reported taking the toll in the state to 119. (READ MORE)

details.title: Uttarakhand tally rises to 2505
details.content:
Uttarakhand detects 103 new #COVID19 positive cases today, taking the total number of positive cases in the state to 2505: State Health Department pic.twitter.com/2Z1yEYsrxc

— ANI (@ANI) June 23, 2020

details.title: COVID-19 facility comes up at college campus in Thane
details.content: The Thane Municipal Corporation has converted 70 classrooms in seven buildings of Vidya Prasarak Mandal (VPM) for the treatment of COVID-19 patients in the city, the official said.

details.title: UP opposition leader tests positive for coronavirus
details.content: Leader of Opposition in the Uttar Pradesh Assembly and Samajwadi Party leader, Ram Govind Chaudhary, has tested positive for coronavirus, an official said on Tuesday. Chaudhary was suffering from fever and cold and was admitted to a private hospital in Lucknow on Monday where his sample was taken for testing, Officer on Special Duty (OSD), Anand Prakash Joshi, said.

details.title: 200 Indian evacuees from Maldives arrive in Tamil Nadu
details.content: Indian Navy Ship Airavat arrived here from Maldives with 200 Indian nationals at the VOC Port this morning, officials said. As many as 64 people who arrived today hailed from Kanyakumari district while the rest were from many other districts, they said.

details.title: East Godavari district in Andhra Pradesh to go under lockdown
details.content:
#EastGodavari #district to undergo #lockdown from #June25 due to increase in number of active #coronavirus cases.@NewIndianXpress #COVID19 #APFightsCorona pic.twitter.com/Bj0BmiN5f8

— TNIE Andhra Pradesh (@xpressandhra) June 23, 2020

details.title: Ramdev launches Ayurvedic medicine for Covid-19, claims 100% recovery
details.content: The Yoga guru claimed that the medicine titled 'Coronil and Swasari' is not an immunity booster but a sure shot cure. “The medicine has healed a Covid-19 patient within 3-7 days. Our clinical trials have proved the efficacy of the medicine to be 100%. We are proud to present the first-ever ayurvedic medicine for the viral infection the world is grappling with. The medicine has been prepared by the combined efforts of Patanjali Research Centre and Nizam I Institute of Medical Sciences," he said.

details.title: Puducherry death toll at 9
details.content: COVID-19 toll rises to 9 in Puducherry with another death; 19 new cases take tally to 402; active cases 228: Health Minister Malladi Krishna Rao.

details.title: PPE availability still a major issue in Indian hospitals: Survey
details.content: The government has been claiming that after the initial weeks when the pandemic hit the country and PPE were only imported, there is no shortage for the past few months as tens of domestic manufacturers are producing nearly 4.5 lakh PPE kits per day now. The latest survey by a group of independent health researchers, however, has confirmed the anecdotal evidence that has been suggesting that frontline workers still are still not getting this equipment.

details.title: Karnataka govt mulls lockdown in Bengaluru again as COVID-19 cases spike
details.content: The Karnataka Health Minister Sriramulu said on Tuesday that a lockdown may be enforced across Bengaluru if the number of COVID-19 cases increases. "Already four regions in Bengaluru have been sealed for 14 days. If the situation continues, we are thinking of a lockdown all over the city. To take a call, we will have a meeting with the CM, COVID-19 task force, experts and officials," he said at a press meet. (READ MORE)

details.title: 11 wards of Guwahati to go under lockdown from June 24
details.content:
Assam: Lockdown to be imposed in 11 wards of Guwahati from 9 pm today, untill further orders. Essential services such as grocery stores, petrol pumps, banks etc to remain functional. #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/ZFhJmHtbVd

— ANI (@ANI) June 23, 2020

details.title: Schools and colleges in Bengal shut till July 31
details.content: All schools and colleges in West Bengal to remain closed till July 31, announces Partha Chatterjee, West Bengal Education Minister.

details.title: Priyanka slams UP govt over high COVID-19 mortality rate in Agra
details.content: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Tuesday attacked the Uttar Pradesh government over the high COVID-19 mortality rate in Agra, saying Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath should clarify within 48 hours who was responsible for "pushing people into these adverse circumstances". (READ MORE)

details.title: Kejriwal writes to Shah requesting deployment of doctors and nurses at COVID care centre
details.content:
Delhi CM @ArvindKejriwal has written to Union Home Minister Amit Shah requesting deployment of doctors and nurses from ITBP and Army at the 10,000-bedded #COVID care centre at Radha Soami Satsang Beas campus- Delhi Govt official @NewIndianXpress @TheMornStandard

— siddhanta mishra (@siddmh_TNIE) June 23, 2020

details.title: 2.35 lakh samples tested in Chennai so far, claims Corporation
details.content: 2.35 lakh samples tested in Chennai out of which 85 per cent are from government testing centres, said Chennai Corporation Commissioner G Prakash

details.title: Nepal’s COVID-19 tally crosses 10000-mark
details.content: Nepal’s COVID-19 tally crossed 10,000-mark on Tuesday after 538 new cases were registered in last 24 hours. "The national tally now stands at 10,099," the Health Ministry said.

details.title: Tennis player Viktor Troicki tests positive for COVID-19
details.content: Viktor Troicki said Tuesday that he and his pregnant wife have both been diagnosed with the virus.The former top-20 player from Serbia played against Djokovic in Belgrade during the first part of the two-leg tour.

details.title: Djokovic tests positive for COVID-19
details.content: Novak Djokovic, the men’s world number one tennis player, has tested positive for COVID-19.

details.title: All shops in Tamil Nadu will be shut on June 24
details.content: All shops in Tamil Nadu will be shut tomorrow (June 24), announced Tamil Nadu Traders Association. This is to protest after two shopkeepers allegedly died in police custody in Sathankulam, Thoothukudi.

details.title: Restaurants in Punjab to allow dine-in facilities with 50 per cent occupancy till 8 pm
details.content: As per the guidelines for restaurants, hotels and other hospitality services, the restaurants would be open for both walk-in and hotel guests. However, the bars in the hotels will remain closed. But liquor could be served in rooms and restaurants as permitted under the excise policy of the state.

details.title: India has one COVID-19 death per lakh population as against 6.04 globally
details.content: Till date, 14,011 people have died in India due to the viral infection with 312 fatalities reported in 24 hours till Tuesday 8 am, while 14,933 new instances of the disease took the total caseload to 4,40,215. Citing WHO Situation Report 154 dated June 22, the ministry said the United Kingdom has registered 63.13 coronavirus-related fatalities per lakh population, while in Spain it is 60.60, Italy 57.19, the US 36.30, Germany 27.32, Brazil 23.68 and Russia 5.62. (READ MORE)

details.title: Kerala records new high with 141 positive cases
details.content:
141 new positive cases, which includes 79 from abroad, 52 from other states, take Kerala's tally to 3451. 

  • Total active cases - 1,620
  • Total deaths - 22
  • Total Hotspots - 111

details.title: AYUSH Ministry puts halt to Patanjali's alleged COVID drug
details.content: AYUSH Ministry orders Patanjali to stop advertising its COVID drug until "issue" is examined. AYUSH says advertisement of Patanjali's alleged drugs regulated under Drugs and Magic Remedies (Objectionable Advertisements) Act, 1954.

details.title: AIIMS Delhi to restart OPDs
details.content: AIIMS Delhi to restart OPDs with physical appointment from June 25. The follow up and old patients to be given priority first. Per day not more than 15 patients across all departments: Administration.

details.content:
Karnataka recorded eight COVID-19 deaths and 322 positive cases in last 24 hours. Discharges cross 6000-mark.

  • State's tally- 9721
  • Active cases - 3563 (120 in ICUs)
  • Deaths - 150(+4)
  • Discharges - 6004 (274 today)

details.title: AIIMS Rishikesh successfully tests low-cost indigenous ventilator
details.content: The ventilator was developed jointly by AIIMS, Rishikesh and Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Roorkee about two months ago. Its cost will range between Rs 25,000 to Rs 30,000.

After Madhya Pradesh, now college students promoted in Haryana sans exams
details.content: Students of these classes will be promoted to next semester with 50% weightage of marks of internal assessment/assignment plus 50% weightage of marks in previous exams. They will have option for exams for improvement of grades by physical exams basis once normalcy prevails: Haryana government.

details.title: Update from Delhi
details.content: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal appoints Principal Secretary (Home) in Delhi Government BS Bhalla as the Nodal Officer for the overall management of COVID-19 in Government of Delhi.

details.title: 370 new cases, 11 deaths in Bengal
details.content: 370 new COVID-19 positive cases and 11 deaths reported in West Bengal, in the last 24 hours. The total number of cases rises to 14,728 including 9,218 discharged, 4,930 active cases and 580 deaths: State Health Department.

details.title: 45 test positive in Goa
details.content: 45 samples have tested positive for COVID-19 today, taking the total number of cases to 909. There are 702 active cases, 205 recovered cases and 2 deaths: Directorate of Health Services, Goa.

details.title: 549 positive cases in Gujarat
details.content: In the last 24 hours, 549 COVID-19 cases and 26 deaths have been reported in Gujarat. State tally rises to 28,429 including 20,521 discharged and 1,711 deaths: State Health Department.

details.title: Two more Mumbai cops succumb to virus outbreak
details.content: Assistant Sub-Inspector Suryakant Jadhav, Marine Drive Police Station and Head Constable Pradeep Kashid, Protection & Security Unit passed away due to coronavirus: Mumbai Police.

details.title: 23 new cases in Manipur
details.content: In last late 24 hours, 23 fresh COVID-19 positive cases have been reported in Manipur. Total number of positive cases stand at 921 including 663 are active cases and 258 recovered cases.

details.title: 85 new cases in Ladakh
details.content: Union Territory Ladakh reports 85 new cases of COVID-19, total active case rise to 783; 12 more patients cured and discharged from Leh district: Department of Information & Public Relations Leh Ladakh.

details.title: 162 new cases in Punjab
details.content: Punjab reports 162 fresh COVID-19 positive cases, taking the total of cases to 4397. Death toll rises to 105 after 4 deaths were reported today: State Health Department.

details.title: Five new cases in Dharavi
details.content: Five new COVID-19 positive cases have been reported in Mumbai's Dharavi area today, taking the total number of cases to 2189: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC).

details.title: Update from ITBP
details.content: Three more personnel of Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) tested positive for COVID-19 in the last 24 hours. There are total 61 active cases & 218 have recovered till date.

details.title: 148 new cases in J&K
details.content: 148 new COVID-19 positive cases have been reported in Jammu and Kashmir today, 20 from Jammu division and 128 from Kashmir division. Two deaths have been reported in the union territory today. Total number of cases stands at 6236 and death toll is at 87.

Armed Forces personnel have been detailed for providing medical care&attention to COVID patients housed in the Railway coaches in Delhi. 8,000 additional beds have already been placed at Delhi government’s disposal for making COVID care centres,as per requirement: Union Home Min

details.title: COVID-19: After Madhya Pradesh, now Haryana not to hold higher education exams next months
details.content: The Haryana government has decided not to hold higher and technical education examinations next month and students will be promoted to the next semester on the basis of internal assessment and previous performance, said state minister Kanwar Pal on Tuesday Earlier, the Haryana's Higher and Technical Education Department had said all terminal examinations of final semesters will be conducted from July 1 to 31. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: COVID-19: Delhi registers nearly 4,000 new cases in record spike as national capital's tally nears 67,000
details.content: A 10,000-bed COVID-19 facility at the premises of Radha Saomi Satsang Beas in south Delhi to be operated by the ITBP will be functional by June 26, Union Home Minister Amit Shah informed Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal after he asked for doctors and nurses from the ITBP and the Army to run the centre. details.title: TMC MLA Tamonash Ghosh dies after testing positive for COVID-19; Mamata mourns loss
details.content: Trinamool Congress (TMC) MLA Tamonash Ghosh, who had tested positive for COVID-19 in May, died at a hospital in Kolkata on Wednesday, party sources said. He was 60. The three-time MLA from the Falta assembly constituency in South 24 Parganas district was admitted to a hospital after he tested positive for the disease, they said. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: 282 COVID-19 cases in Odisha in last 24 hours, state tally touches 5752
details.content:
282 COVID-19 positive cases in Odisha during the last 24 hours, state tally reaches 5752 @XpressOdisha @NewIndianXpress

— Bijay Chaki (@bijay_TNIE) June 24, 2020

details.title: After CRPF, ITBP now 15 BSF personnel test positive in Chhattisgarh
details.content: Fifteen personnel of Border Security Force (BSF) have tested positive for novel coronavirus in an edge district of Kanker, north Bastar, about 180 km from Raipur, on Wednesday. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: 12 trainee sailors of INS Shivaji test positive for COVID-19
details.content: At least 12 trainee sailors of the Lonavala-based INS Shivaji, one of the premier training establishments of the Indian Navy, have so far tested positive for coronavirus, officials said. The naval establishment, spread over 800 acres in the hill town of Lonavala in Maharashtra's Pune district, houses a population of nearly 5,000. Out of these, 3,000 are naval personnel, including officers, sailors, trainees and other staff. The rest include their family members, a senior naval officer said. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Kerala Cabinet approves PPE kit for air passengers
details.content:
Kerala Cabinet approves PPE kit for air passengers. A relief to thousands of expats trapped in foreign countries TNIE impact. @NewIndianXpress @MSKiranPrakash @pendown @Anandans76

— Biju E Paul (@bijuepaul_TNIE) June 24, 2020

details.title: All government offices in Odisha's Ganjam district to remain closed for 10 days
details.content:
As the number of #COVID19 cases in Ganjam crosses 1000 mark with detection of 76 new cases, all Govt offices in the district will remain closed for citizens for next 10 days. Decision taken after some senior officers catch the infection. #Odisha @XpressOdisha @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/rM4adClvoM

— Hemant Kumar Rout #StayHomeStaySafe (@TheHemantRout) June 24, 2020

details.title: Not Shah model vs Kejriwal model, implement system in which people don't face problems: Sisodia to Shah
details.content: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Wednesday wrote to Union Home Minister Amit Shah, seeking his intervention in scrapping the system requiring every COVID-19 patient to visit a government-run centre for clinical assessment. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Containment zones in Chennai's Tondiarpet up from 24 to 38 in 2 days
details.content: Twenty of the 38 containment zones in Tondiarpet were initiated on a single day of  June 23. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Odisha COVID-19 tally
details.content:
Breaking: #Covid tally in #Bhubaneswar crosses 200-mark as 22 more including 16 from Blue Wheel hospital test +ve for #coronavirus in the last 24 hours. This is also the highest single-day spike of cases in the city so far. More details awaited from @bmcbbsr.@NewIndianXpress.

— Sudarsan Maharana (@Sud_TNIE) June 24, 2020

details.title: Can't permit ICSE board exams in Maharashtra amid COVID-19: State government tells Bombay HC
details.content:
Advocate General Ashutosh Kumbhakoni, appearing for the state, told a division bench of Chief Justice Dipankar Datta and Justice SS Shinde that the State Disaster Management Committee, under the chairmanship of Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray, held a meeting on Tuesday where it was decided not to permit the ICSE board to conduct its exams.

FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: UDF stir led to Kerala govt's U-turn on COVID negative certificates for expats: Chennithala
details.content: The Kerala government's decision to allow expatriates wearing PPE kits if the countries from where they depart do not conduct COVID-19 tests is a face-saving gesture after widespread protests by the UDF, said Opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala.

details.title: COVID situation in Kerala
details.content:
Kerala afternoon news updates. Climb down on Covid- certificates; suicide by SNDP official and many other developments.@likhithanair92 brings the updates@NewIndianXpress @MSKiranPrakash pic.twitter.com/U618DxtBgD

— TNIE Kerala (@xpresskerala) June 24, 2020

details.title: Delhi government prepares 'Revised COVID Response plan'
details.content: Delhi govt prepares eight-point 'Revised COVID Response Plan' in line with recommendations of Dr VK Paul committee. The plan includes conducting sero-survey of 20,000 people across districts and house-to-house screening by July 6, among other measures.

details.title: COVID-19 facility in Delhi
details.content:
Delhi government has started converting Radha Soami Spiritual Centre into a #COVID19 care facility. It will have over 200 halls and 10,000 beds.
Express photos | @Shekharyadav02.@TheMornStandard pic.twitter.com/OEXKbTb1rM

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) June 24, 2020

details.title: India Railways for COVID care
details.content: First patient arrives at Railways' COVID care centre in Delhi's Shakur Basti; around 15 more are expected to come: Railways

details.title: EAM Jaishankar on Passport Sewa Diwas
details.content: I would like to felicitate all our passport issuing authorities in India and abroad on Passport Sewa Diwas and I'm sure you all appreciate we're meeting under unique circumstances. I acknowledge how well all of you have responded to changing public requirements amid COVID. We intend to open Post Office Passport Seva Kendras in every Lok Sabha constituency where no PSK exists today. We've so far been able to provide for 488 Lok Sabha constituencies. This process which we were going forward with very ambitiously,stopped momentarily due to COVID19: EAM S Jaishankar

details.title: ICMR asks hospitals to start rapid antigen tests as daily Covid-19 cases near 16,000-mark
details.content: The advisory said that all medical colleges, govt hospitals, accredited private hospitals, and diagnostic labs approved to do the testing should use the antigen-based testing methods.

details.title: Wedding in the times of COVID-19
details.content:
Couple enters wedlock amid #lockdown in Chennai's Korukkupet.
Express photo | P Jawahar. @xpresstn pic.twitter.com/vgbdJX7eCd

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) June 24, 2020

details.title: Work for 10 days, get 10 days off: Kerala's new plan for COVID care workers
details.content:
As per the decision, the available human resources will be divided into the COVID pool, off-duty pool and routine pool. Those in the COVID pool will go to the off-duty pool, then to the routine pool and finally back to the COVID pool.

FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: BMC to procure one lakh antigen testing kits
details.content: The release stated that these kits will be used at all civic, state-run hospitals and COVID-19 treatment facilities to test suspected patients and ensure timely treatment. At present, RT-PCR tests are being used to detect infections, but the results of antigen tests will be comparatively faster, the civic body said.

details.title: No coronavirus, she's better now: Kunal Kohli gives update on Saroj Khan
details.content: Giving an update on the health of veteran choreographer Saroj Khan, filmmaker Kunal Kohli said that he spoke to Khan's son and inquired about her health condition. The 'Hum Tum' director took to Twitter to share the update with Khan's well-wishers

details.title: TCS New York Marathon cancelled

details.title: Bengal extends lockdown till July 31st
details.content: Lockdown in the state extended till 31st July with certain relaxations: West Bengal Government.

details.title: Latest Gujarat numbers
details.content: In the last 24 hours, 572 COVID-19 positive cases and 25 deaths reported in Gujarat. State tally rises to 29,001 including 21,096 cured/discharged and 1,736 deaths: State Health Department.

details.title: 226 new cases in Assam
details.content: 226 new COVID-19 positive cases reported in Assam today, taking the total number of cases in the state to 6282: State Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma.

details.title: Update from Odisha
details.content: A massive COVID-19 test of all servitors, police personnel and Jagannath Temple Administration officials associated with #RathaYatra will be done for the second time. Masks and sanitizers will be given to servitors & their families: Odisha Government.

details.title: Update from Karnataka
details.content: 100% of Community Health Centers, 50% of Primary Health Centers and Urban Primary Health Centers will be converted as exclusive 'fever clinics' to screen fever cases for influenza-like illness (ILI)/severe acute respiratory infections (SARI): Karnataka Health Department.

details.title: WATCH | COVID-19: This Bengaluru artist spreads awareness through his paintings
Karnataka ramps up treatment facilities for its COVID-19 infected cops
details.content: A floor in Sri Sri Ravishankar Ashram, Kanakpura road is reserved for asymptomatic and mild symptomatic police personnel infected with COVID-19. ESI hospital in Indiranagar is notified as dedicated COVID-19 hospital for treatment of severe and symptomatic police personnel: Government of Karnataka.

details.title: Ten new cases in Mumbai's Dharavi
details.content: 10 new COVID-19 positive cases reported in Dharavi area of Mumbai, taking the total number of cases in the area to 2199 including 1018 active patients, 1100 recovered/discharged and 81 deaths: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation.

details.title: 186 new cases in J&K
details.content: 186 new COVID-19 positive cases have been reported in Jammu and Kashmir today- 28 from Jammu division and 158 from Kashmir division. The total number of cases stands at 6422 and death toll is at 88.

details.title: Good news from Punjab
details.content: The first plasma therapy has successfully been administered to two COVID-19 positive patients at Government Medical College, Amritsar: Government of Punjab.

details.title: Himachal tally nears 800
details.content: Number of COVID-19 cases reaches 778 in Himachal Pradesh out of which 318 cases are active. Six people have died due to the disease so far: State Health Department.

details.title: Four new cases in ITBP
details.content: Four new cases of COVID-19 reported in Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) over last 24 hours; active cases in the force now stand at 65, out of which 18 are in Delhi. Condition of all admitted is stable: ITBP statement.

details.title: Two deaths and 185 new cases among Maharashtra cops
details.content: In the last 48 hours, two deaths and 185 new COVID-19 positive cases have been reported in Maharashtra Police; the total number of positive cases rises to 4288 including 998 active cases, 3239 recoveries and 51 deaths.

details.title: Delhi government's latest action plan
details.content: Delhi government prepares eight-point 'Revised COVID Response Plan' in line with recommendations of Dr VK Paul committee. The plan includes conducting sero-survey of 20,000 people across districts and house-to-house screening by July 6, among other measures.

details.title: Latest Puducherry numbers
details.content: Puducherry reports 59 new positive cases of COVID-19, taking the total number of cases to 461 including 176 recoveries and nine deaths.

details.title: Markets in Mysuru to be closed
details.content: Mysuru City Corporation issues an order to close Devaraja market, Santhepete, Shivaramapete, Mannars market and Boti Bazaar for the next four days in view of the increasing number of COVID-19 cases.

details.title: Chandigarh tally
details.content: The total number of COVID-19 positive cases in Chandigarh stands at 420, six deaths: Chandigarh Health Department.

details.title: 33 new cases in Uttarakhand
details.content: Uttarakhand reports 33 new cases of COVID-19, taking total number of active cases to 863. Number of deaths due to the disease stands at 35: State Health Department.

details.title: Bengal extends lockdown till July 31st
details.content:
• West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday announced extension of the lockdown in the state till July 31 to contain the spread of COVID-19.
  • The ongoing lockdown in West Bengal was to end on June 30.
  • Banerjee, after attending an all-party meeting held at an auditorium adjacent to the state secretariat, said though there were differences of opinion among the leaders, it was finally decided to extend the curbs till the end of July with relaxations.

details.title: Maharashtra numbers
details.content:
In Maharashtra, total 1,42,900 #Covid_19 positive patients, 6739 deaths and 73,792 recovery. Today, 3890 new cases, 208 deaths and 4161 discharge reported. @NewIndianXpress @Sunday_Standard

— Sudhir Suryawanshi (@ss_suryawanshi) June 24, 2020

details.title: Tell actors and crew members to bring COVIDD-19 negative certificates: Film producers to Uddhav government
details.content: We've written to Maharashtra Government, demanding that the government make it mandatory for actors and crew members to bring COVID-19 negative certificates to film sets. Why should only producers be held responsible?: Indian Motion Pictures Producers Association TP Aggarwal in Delhi.

details.title: Latest Rajasthan numbers
details.content:
Rajasthan reports 10 deaths and 382 new #COVID19 positive cases today. The total number of positive cases in the state stands at 16009 including 3023 active cases and 375 deaths: State Health Department pic.twitter.com/rqoBEjkTpt

— ANI (@ANI) June 24, 2020

details.title: Karnataka gears up for exams amid pandemic
details.content:
Karnataka: Sanitization work undertaken at examination centres in Kalaburagi today, ahead of Secondary School Leaving Certificate (SSLC) exams that will commence tomorrow. #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/pGA8ytrK5Q

— ANI (@ANI) June 24, 2020

details.title: Latest Goa numbers
details.content:
42 new positive cases reported today, taking the total number of positive cases in the state to 951 including 660 active cases, 289 recovered and 2 deaths: Goa Health Department pic.twitter.com/4ANSgf2oUC

— ANI (@ANI) June 24, 2020

details.title: 445 new cases in Bengal
details.content: 445 new COVID-19 positive cases and 11 deaths reported in West Bengal, in the last 24 hours. The total number of cases rises to 15,173 in the state including 9,702 discharged, 4,880 active cases and 591 deaths: State Health Department.

details.title: Uttrakhand cases cross 2600 mark
details.content: The total number of COVID-19 positive cases in Uttarakhand is now 2623: State Health Department.

details.title: 490 new cases in Haryana
details.content: 490 new COVID-19 positive cases reported in Haryana today, taking the total number of positive cases to 12,010. A total of 6925 people have recovered/discharged till date. The total death toll rises to 188: Health Department, Government of Haryana.

details.title: More than 800 new cases in Telangana
details.content: Telangana records 891 new COVID-19 cases today, taking the total number of cases in the state to 10,444: State Health Department..

CM Uddhav Thackeray has written to PM Narendra Modi requesting intervention to direct the Medical Council of India to postpone the MD/MS examination till December 2020 as the final year resident doctors are playing a crucial role in fighting this pandemic: Maharashtra CM's Office pic.twitter.com/N1ElI30TXc

— ANI (@ANI) June 24, 2020

The flight from Washington DC bound for Delhi has taken off with 224 passengers including infants: Embassy of India in Washington, DC #VandeBharatMissionphase3 pic.twitter.com/c98sLQ6geS

— ANI (@ANI) June 24, 2020

details.title: 18 new cases in Jharkhand
details.content: 18 more COVID-19 positive cases and 55 recovered cases reported in Jharkhand today. Total number of cases in the state is now at 2219 including 632 active cases, 1575 recovered/discharged and 12 deaths: State Health Department.

details.title: WATCH | Karnataka news bulletin
details.content:
Ktaka reached the 10k plus mark of covid cases , 397 cases were reported on Wednesday and 14 covid deaths@iffathfathima6 and @vinodkumart5 bring updates
Follow @XpressBengaluru to get #TNIEupdatesOnCovid19 pic.twitter.com/NwxtFGzuic

— TNIE Karnataka (@XpressBengaluru) June 24, 2020

details.title: Telangana to get Remdesivir drug
details.content:
#Telangana will be receiving 1,600 vials of the drug Remdesivir, authorised by ICMR as an investigational therapy for emergency medical use among Covid-19 patients, to be delivered within a week's time by #Hyderabad-based pharmaceutical company, Hetero Drugs.

— TNIE Telangana (@XpressHyderabad) June 24, 2020

details.title: 3,788 fresh COVID cases in Delhi take tally to over 70,000; serosurvey, contact tracing to be intensified
details.content: According to the bulletin, 41,437 patients have recovered, been discharged or migrated so far, while the number of active cases stood at 26,588, adding that 4,20,707 tests have been conducted till now. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Latest Madhya Pradesh numbers
details.content: 187 COVID-19 cases, nine deaths and 138 recoveries reported in Madhya Pradesh on 24th June (yesterday). Total number of cases in the state is now at 12,448, including 9,473 recovered, 2,441 active cases & 534 deaths: State Health Department.

details.title: Shimla gears up for tourism challenges in post-COVID world
details.content:
Shimla: An awareness&training programme for COVID19 preparedness was held by tourism industry stakeholders. Pres of Tourism Industry Stakeholders Association says,"Shimla is first city in country to take such initiative. We will train hotel staff so tourists feel safe". (24.6.20) pic.twitter.com/I2EYdUBbT5

— ANI (@ANI) June 24, 2020
